newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares sink back, fail to rally on rate cut.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares sink back, fail to rally on rate cut.

text.p: Danish share prices closed lower on Friday after failing in a rather lethargic market to rally on the morning's central bank 14-day rate cut with dealers seeing similar levels early next week.
"The long expected rate cut was discounted by the market, so when it came it failed to fuel any rises, late profit-taking in some shares did not help either," one dealer said.

The KFX top-20 index lost 0.35 point to 119.80 in overall bourse turnover of 760 million crowns. The KFX September future fell 0.45 point to 119.90 with 291 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
The two biggest banks Den Danske and Unibank were most in focus, each attracting turnover of around 300,000 shares.
Performances were mixed on top of their interim results earlier in the week, with Den Danske Bank closing unchanged at 402, while rival Unibank shod three crowns to finish at 261.
